items.title: Another Bumper Issue
items.description:
Hey everyone!

Another bumper issue this week, with lots of things to read!

I was back at work this week and managed to survive until Friday so yay! ;)

Hope you all have a fantastic weekend and see you all next week!

Luce ðŸ§¡

items.title: Learn how to get the most out of Xamarin.Forms
Top Xamarin Blog Posts of 2019
items.description:
2019 was an awesome year for Xamarin developers! It was packed full with new releases, exciting events, and product announcements. As well as brand new features to boost productivity and accelerate mobile development.

Top Xamarin Blog Posts of 2019 by James Montemagno
items.description_markdown:
2019 was an awesome year for Xamarin developers! It was packed full with new releases, exciting events, and product announcements. As well as brand new features to boost productivity and accelerate mobile development.

[**Top Xamarin Blog Posts of 2019**](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/xamarin/top-xamarin-blog-posts-2019/) by [James Montemagno](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/xamarin/author/jamesmontemagno/)

items.title: Building a mobile application with GrialKit and UXDivers
items.description:
Building a mobile application is hard. Building a beautiful mobile application is even more difficult. As a mobile developer without strong design skills, building a good-looking application for people to use directly from the app store is quite a challenge.

Building a mobile application with GrialKit and UXDivers by Jon Douglas
items.description_markdown:
Building a mobile application is hard. Building a beautiful mobile application is even more difficult. As a mobile developer without strong design skills, building a good-looking application for people to use directly from the app store is quite a challenge.

[**Building a mobile application with GrialKit and UXDivers**](https://jon-douglas.com/2020/01/02/mobile-app-grialkit/) by [Jon Douglas](https://twitter.com/_JonDouglas)

embedded_links.title: **Building a mobile application with GrialKit and UXDivers**

items.title: Git Rebase: Donâ€™t be Afraid of the Force (Push)
items.description:
While contributing to a big OSS project itâ€™s quite useful to know how to do a Git rebase. And more importantly: donâ€™t be afraid of the Git force push. In this post, Gerald writes a little about the why and the how. Finally, your change is ready for the world to see.

Git Rebase: Donâ€™t be Afraid of the Force (Push) by Gerald Versluis
items.description_markdown:
While contributing to a big OSS project itâ€™s quite useful to know how to do a Git rebase. And more importantly: donâ€™t be afraid of the Git force push. In this post, Gerald writes a little about the why and the how. Finally, your change is ready for the world to see.

[**Git Rebase: Donâ€™t be Afraid of the Force (Push)**](https://blog.verslu.is/git/git-rebase/) by [Gerald Versluis](https://twitter.com/jfversluis/)

items.title: More Readable Tests with NUnit and FluentAssertions [Portugese]
items.description:
Tests are important in any project, regardless of the technology stack. NUnit is a common testing framework and FluentAssertions allow you to write more readable tests which helps encourage everyone to keep high test coverage and quality. But FluentAssertions and NUnit.Xamarin can be a bit hard to get to play nicely.

Testes mais legÃ­veis com FluentAssertions em projetos nUnit.Xamarin by Mahmoud Ali
items.description_markdown:
Tests are important in any project, regardless of the technology stack. NUnit is a common testing framework and FluentAssertions allow you to write more readable tests which helps encourage everyone to keep high test coverage and quality. But FluentAssertions and NUnit.Xamarin can be a bit hard to get to play nicely.

[**Testes mais legÃ­veis com FluentAssertions em projetos nUnit.Xamarin**](http://high5devs.com/2019/12/testes-mais-legiveis-com-fluentassertions-em-projetos-nunit-xamarin/) by [Mahmoud Ali](http://high5devs.com/author/akamud/)

items.title: Using Firebase Analytics in your Xamarin.Forms app
items.description:
We all know and love Microsoftâ€™s AppCenter offering when it comes to analytics and crash reporting for our mobile apps. But sometimes you want more in-depth analysis. A tool like Firebase can help with that!

Using Firebase Analytics in your Xamarin.Forms app by Steven Thewissen
items.description_markdown:
We all know and love Microsoftâ€™s AppCenter offering when it comes to analytics and crash reporting for our mobile apps. But sometimes you want more in-depth analysis. A tool like Firebase can help with that!

[**Using Firebase Analytics in your Xamarin.Forms app**](https://www.thewissen.io/using-firebase-analytics-in-your-xamarin-forms-app/) by [Steven Thewissen](https://www.thewissen.io/author/steven/)

embedded_links.title: **Using Firebase Analytics in your Xamarin.Forms app**

items.title: Easily differentiate versions of your applications using Azure DevOps
items.description:
When you develop a mobile application you always have different versions and each one has a specific environment. During the entire life of your project you switch between each versions to try new features or to correct some bugs.

Easily differentiate versions of your applications using Azure DevOps by Damien Aicheh
items.description_markdown:
When you develop a mobile application you always have different versions and each one has a specific environment. During the entire life of your project you switch between each versions to try new features or to correct some bugs.

[**Easily differentiate versions of your applications using Azure DevOps**](https://damienaicheh.github.io/azure/devops/2020/01/09/easily-differentiate-versions-of-your-applications-using-azure-devops-en.html) by [Damien Aicheh](https://damienaicheh.github.io/about)

embedded_links.title: **Easily differentiate versions of your applications using Azure DevOps**

items.title: Adventures in Low Overhead Dependency Injection using DryIoCZero
items.description:
Dependency Injection (DI) might be one of the more polarising topics in the Xamarin community. But Ryan shows you how to reduce the overhead of using DI.

Adventures in Low Overhead Dependency Injection using DryIoCZero by Ryan Davis
items.description_markdown:
Dependency Injection (DI) might be one of the more polarising topics in the Xamarin community. But Ryan shows you how to reduce the overhead of using DI.

[**Adventures in Low Overhead Dependency Injection using DryIoCZero**](https://ryandavis.io/adventures-in-low-overhead-dependency-injection-using-dryioczero/) by [Ryan Davis](http://ryandavis.io/author/ryan)

embedded_links.title: **Adventures in Low Overhead Dependency Injection using DryIoCZero**

items.title: Multiple Environments Using ApkTool Extension for Azure DevOps
items.description:
In my last couple of posts (here and here) I talked a bit about using the ApkTool to repack an Android APK in order to update an Android application to target different environments. To make this easier Iâ€™ve just published a preview of an extension for Azure DevOps.

Multiple Environments Using ApkTool Extension for Azure DevOps by Nick Randolph
items.description_markdown:
In my last couple of posts (here and here) I talked a bit about using the ApkTool to repack an Android APK in order to update an Android application to target different environments. To make this easier Iâ€™ve just published a preview of an extension for Azure DevOps.

[**Multiple Environments Using ApkTool Extension for Azure DevOps**](https://nicksnettravels.builttoroam.com/apktool-extension-azure-devops/) by [Nick Randolph](https://nicksnettravels.builttoroam.com/author/nick/)

embedded_links.title: **Multiple Environments Using ApkTool Extension for Azure DevOps**

items.title: Building Quality iOS Apps, Quickly
items.description:
Quality isnâ€™t the only concern when building an app for your business. Often, itâ€™s also important to get these apps in the App Store as quickly as possible.

items.title: How to use Multiple View Controller in Single Page in Xamarin iOS
items.description:
There is no easy solution to handling showing multiple view controllers from inside a single view controller in iOS. But this post shows it is possible!

How to use Multiple View Controller in Single Page in Xamarin iOS by Logesh Palani
items.description_markdown:
There is no easy solution to handling showing multiple view controllers from inside a single view controller in iOS. But this post shows it is possible!

[**How to use Multiple View Controller in Single Page in Xamarin iOS**](https://logeshpalani.blogspot.com/2020/01/how-to-use-multiple-view-controller-in.html) by [Logesh Palani](https://www.blogger.com/profile/11572235997627400122)

items.title: Prism for Xamarin.Forms: IConfirmNavigation
items.description:
Many of you use Prism in your Xamarin.Forms projects. The IConfirmNavigation feature allows you to confirm or prevent navigation from the ViewModel.

Prism for Xamarin.Forms: IConfirmNavigation by Almir Vuk
items.description_markdown:
Many of you use Prism in your Xamarin.Forms projects. The IConfirmNavigation feature allows you to confirm or prevent navigation from the ViewModel.

items.title: Introducing Xamarin.Forms Time Picker
items.description:
Syncfusion's Essential Studio 2019 is a great toolkit for complex and beautiful Xamarin.Forms components. In Volume 4, they introduced a Time Picker.

Introducing Xamarin.Forms Time Picker by Paul Anderson
items.description_markdown:
Syncfusion's Essential Studio 2019 is a great toolkit for complex and beautiful Xamarin.Forms components. In Volume 4, they introduced a Time Picker.

items.title: Easily Animate your Xamarin Applications with Lottie Animation
items.description:
Adding simple animations to any application will make it look better. Xamarin.Forms provides native options to work with animations. But using Lottie animations makes it easier to add animation to your application.

Easily Animate your Xamarin Applications with Lottie Animation by Meikanda Nayanar
items.description_markdown:
Adding simple animations to any application will make it look better. Xamarin.Forms provides native options to work with animations. But using Lottie animations makes it easier to add animation to your application.

[**Easily Animate your Xamarin Applications with Lottie Animation**](https://www.syncfusion.com/blogs/post/easily-animate-xamarin-application-with-lottie.aspx) by [Meikanda Nayanar](https://www.syncfusion.com/blogs/author/meikandaisyncfusion-com)

embedded_links.title: **Easily Animate your Xamarin Applications with Lottie Animation**

items.title: Xamarin.Forms Markdown [Portugese]
items.description:
Markdown has mixed views but it can be a useful format for writing nice user documentation for example. Ever wanted to include nice markdown formatted information inside your app? Read on to find out how!

O X do Xamarin Forms by Thiago Bertuzzi
items.description_markdown:
Markdown has mixed views but it can be a useful format for writing nice user documentation for example. Ever wanted to include nice markdown formatted information inside your app? Read on to find out how!

items.title: Accessibility in Xamarin.Forms
items.description:
In the last American census, it was estimated that 18.7% of the population has some type of disability and of those, according to the Pew Internet Project, 54% utilize internet connected services and devices.

items.description_markdown:

items.title: Learning about Embedded Images in Xamarin Forms
items.description:
Embedded images are a lesser known solution to the issue of having to put a load of images of different resolutions, into each platform in your solution. Read on to find out how to use them!

Learning about Embedded Images in Xamarin Forms by Leomaris Reyes
items.description_markdown:
Embedded images are a lesser known solution to the issue of having to put a load of images of different resolutions, into each platform in your solution. Read on to find out how to use them!

[**Learning about Embedded Images in Xamarin Forms**](https://askxammy.com/learning-about-embedded-images-in-xamarin-forms/) by [Leomaris Reyes](https://askxammy.com/author/leoreyes/)

embedded_links.title: **Learning about Embedded Images in Xamarin Forms**

items.title: Play Device Information (Xamarin.Essentials API of the Week)
items.description:
Xamarin.Essentials provides developers with cross-platform APIs for their mobile applications. On this week's Xamarin.Essential API of the week, take a look at the Device Info API that can give developers information about the device they are using.

items.description_markdown:
